preibisch_imagej

Class Extents

  • java.lang.Object
    • preibisch_imagelib2.AbstractEuclideanSpace
      • preibisch_imagelib2.AbstractInterval
        • preibisch_imagej.Extents
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dimensions, EuclideanSpace, Interval, RealInterval

    public class Extents
extends AbstractInterval
    This class wraps a pair of min and max dimensions encoded as long[]'s. It facilitates the creation of Position indexes for iterating within the Extents.
    Author:
    Barry DeZonia

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class preibisch_imagelib2.AbstractInterval

        max, min

      • Fields inherited from class preibisch_imagelib2.AbstractEuclideanSpace

        n

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Extents(long[] dims)
      Constructor that takes a dimensional extent and sets min to a zero origin and each max dim i to dims[i]-1.
      Extents(long[] min, long[] max)
      Constructor that takes min and max extents.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Position createPosition()
      Returns a Position object that can be used to iterate these Extents.
      long numElements()
      Returns the total number of elements spanned by the parent Extents.
      String toString()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Extents

        public Extents(long[] dims)
        Constructor that takes a dimensional extent and sets min to a zero origin and each max dim i to dims[i]-1.

      • Extents

        public Extents(long[] min,
               long[] max)
        Constructor that takes min and max extents. No checking is done that min <= max for all dim i.

    • Method Detail

        Returns the total number of elements spanned by the parent Extents.
